potatoes.name: All Blue
potatoes.flavor: Moist firm flesh with slightly grainy texture
potatoes.usage: Fresh market. Especially suited to potato salads.

potatoes.name: Alturas Russet
potatoes.flavor: Culinary quality is high, with larger tubers suitable for fresh market
potatoes.usage: Grown primarily for the processed market. Its resistance to the accumulation of sugars during long-term storage also makes it suitable for processing out of storage into French fries. Makes excellent mashed potatoes.

potatoes.name: Ama Rosa
potatoes.shape: Small to medium size, firm, oblong-shaped
potatoes.usage: Ideal for baking, roasting, and grilling. They also make mouth-watering and colorful potato chips because they retain their sweetness and bright red color.

potatoes.name: Bannock Russet
potatoes.shape: Attractive russeted skin and short tuber length
potatoes.usage: When stored at 45Â°F, the Bannock Russet produces a lighter fry color and has a lower glucose concentration than a Russet Burbank. Medium to high solids.

potatoes.name: Bintje
potatoes.shape: Small to medium size round tubers, smooth and well-rounded
potatoes.flavor: Exceptional flavor. Some describe it as having a unique, light, nut-like flavor.
potatoes.usage: Best served roasted or as French fries; often seen as the standard for European-style or Belgian fries.

potatoes.name: Blazer Russet
potatoes.shape: Oblong, medium to large tubers that average about 7 to 8 oz. each
potatoes.color: Brown to tan with light russeting
potatoes.flavor: A distinctive, earthy potato flavor, yields dry and fluffy baked potatoes and golden fries with crisp outer flesh and dry mashed flavor center.
potatoes.usage: Well suited for fresh-market sale or for potato processors to make into frozen potato products.

potatoes.name: Cal Red
potatoes.shape: Round and smooth shape, shallow eyes
potatoes.flavor: Waxy; makes a good potato salad; skin color stays red.

potatoes.name: Classic Russet
potatoes.flavor: High culinary rating, with distinctive, earthy flavor. It is light and fluffy in baking and produces light fries after harvest and shortly thereafter.
potatoes.usage: Sold in fresh-pack markets and processed right out of the field or during the early storage season.
